hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Compression Breakout Regime Transition
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC 20-day realized volatility falls below 30% (compression) during NEUTRAL regime, and then breaks above 45% with 2+ standard deviation volume spike, the subsequent 5-day period will show >70% probability of transitioning to BULL regime if breakout is upward, or BEAR regime if downward.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Volatility compression often precedes significant regime shifts. The combination of low volatility + high volume breakout provides high signal-to-noise ratio for detecting genuine regime transitions versus false breakouts.
entry_conditions: BTC 20-day realized volatility < 30% for 5+ consecutive days
Daily volatility spike > 45% with volume 2+ std above 20-day average
Price breaks 20-day ATR channel (high or low)

exit_conditions.take_profit: 5 days after entry OR regime classification changes
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Volatility returns below 35% within 2 days of entry
exit_conditions.time_exit: 7 days if no regime transition occurs

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If >50% of such signals fail to produce regime transition within 7 days, or if false breakout rate exceeds 40%.
